Class Field

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.shape.Shape
javafx.scene.shape.Circle
grab.szan.Field
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class Field extends javafx.scene.shape.Circle
Represents a single field (circle) on the client-side board. Each field has coordinates (row, col), an ID representing its occupant, and methods for highlighting or un-highlighting itself.

  • Property Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • Field

      public Field(double radius, int i, int j)
      Creates a new Field (circle) with the specified radius, row, and column. Calculates its position on the board based on row, column, and radius.
      Parameters:
      radius - the radius of the circle
      i - the row index
      j - the column index

  • Method Details

      Gets the row index of this field.
      Returns:

      Gets the column index of this field.
      Returns:
      the column index

      public void setFieldId(int id)
      Sets the ID of this field.
      Parameters:
      id - the new ID for the field

    • getFieldId

      public int getFieldId()
      Gets the ID of this field.
      Returns:
      the field ID

    • highlight

      public void highlight()
      Highlights this field by changing its stroke color and width.

    • removeHighlight

      public void removeHighlight()
      Removes the highlight from this field, resetting stroke color and width to default.
